name: Cho Sun-hyung
summary: Cho Sun-hyung is a Korean textile scientist who advanced dyeing and finishing technology in South Korea's textile industry. Her research on environmentally friendly dyeing processes helped Korean textile manufacturers meet international environmental standards while maintaining product quality.

name: Kwon Hyuk-sang
summary: Kwon Hyuk-sang was a Korean veterinary pathologist who advanced diagnostic pathology for Korean livestock diseases. His work on identifying and treating zoonotic diseases helped protect both animal and human health in South Korea's growing livestock industry.

name: Kim Chang-kyeong
summary: Kim Chang-kyeong is a Korean physicist who pioneered photovoltaic solar energy research in South Korea. His work on silicon solar cell efficiency improvement contributed to the development of Korea's solar energy industry, which now includes major manufacturers like Hanwha Q Cells.

name: Jeon Byeong-su
summary: Jeon Byeong-su is a Korean acoustics engineer who developed noise control and acoustic design technologies for Korean buildings and infrastructure. His research on sound insulation and room acoustics has improved the quality of Korean concert halls, recording studios, and residential buildings.
timeline: Designed acoustics for major Korean venues

name: Park Se-joo
summary: Park Se-joo is a Korean biomedical scientist who has made contributions to cancer biology research. His studies on signal transduction pathways in cancer cells have advanced understanding of cancer mechanisms and potential therapeutic targets, contributing to Korea's growing biopharmaceutical research sector.

name: Chung Myung-whun
summary: While Chung Myung-whun is primarily a conductor and pianist, his role as music director of the Seoul Philharmonic and various European orchestras has demonstrated the systematic, analytical approach to musical interpretation that parallels scientific methodology. His work has elevated Korean cultural technology internationally.
timeline: Won second prize at Tchaikovsky Competition
Became music director of Op√©ra de la Bastille
Became music director of Seoul Philharmonic

name: Lee Gwang-bok
summary: Lee Gwang-bok was a Korean oceanographer who established marine science research programs around the Korean Peninsula. His systematic studies of ocean currents, water temperature, and marine ecosystems provided baseline data essential for Korean fisheries management and marine resource development.

name: Im Tae-hwan
summary: Im Tae-hwan is a Korean materials scientist at Seoul National University who has made significant contributions to mesoporous nanomaterials and photocatalysis. His work on nanostructured catalysts for water splitting and pollution degradation has advanced Korean environmental technology.

name: Kim Gyeong-ran
summary: Kim Gyeong-ran is a Korean virologist who contributed to South Korea's infectious disease response capability. Her research on respiratory viruses helped Korea respond effectively to the MERS outbreak in 2015 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, demonstrating Korea's public health preparedness.
timeline: Joined Korean infectious disease research center

name: Bae Yong-chan
summary: Bae Yong-chan is a Korean electronics engineer who contributed to the development of LED lighting technology in South Korea. His research on high-efficiency LEDs helped Korean companies like Samsung LED and LG Innotek become major global players in the LED market.
timeline: Korean LED industry became globally competitive

name: Shin Eun-chul
summary: Shin Eun-chul is a Korean chemical engineer who has developed advanced desalination and water treatment technologies. His research on reverse osmosis membranes has contributed to Korea's water technology exports, with Korean-made desalination plants operating in the Middle East and other water-scarce regions.
timeline: Korean desalination technology exported to Middle East

name: Yang Jun-mo
summary: Yang Jun-mo is a Korean construction engineer who developed advanced tunneling techniques for South Korea's extensive subway and road tunnel systems. His innovations in tunnel boring machine operations and underground construction safety have been crucial for building Korea's infrastructure.

name: Choe Jeong-ho
summary: Choe Jeong-ho is a Korean microelectronics engineer who contributed to the development of system-on-chip (SoC) design in South Korea. His research on integrated circuit design has supported the development of Korean semiconductor companies' application processor products used in smartphones worldwide.
timeline: Contributed to Korean application processor development

name: Lee Woo-il
summary: Lee Woo-il is a Korean paper scientist who advanced pulp and paper manufacturing technology in South Korea. His research on paper recycling technology and bio-based materials has helped Korea's paper industry become more sustainable and environmentally friendly.
timeline: Advanced Korean pulp and paper technology

name: Park Yeong-ho
summary: Park Yeong-ho is a Korean agricultural economist who studied the economic aspects of Korea's Green Revolution and food security policies. His research on agricultural technology adoption and food distribution systems influenced Korean food policy and agricultural development strategies.

name: Kim Tae-gi
summary: Kim Tae-gi is a Korean hydraulic engineer who contributed to the design and construction of major dams in South Korea. His work on dam safety analysis and flood control systems has been critical for managing Korea's water resources and protecting against flooding.

name: Jang Hyo-hee
summary: Jang Hyo-hee is a Korean pharmaceutical scientist who has contributed to drug formulation and delivery research at Korean pharmaceutical companies. Her research on controlled-release drug delivery systems has helped Korea's pharmaceutical industry develop more effective medications.

name: Seo Jeong-min
summary: Seo Jeong-min is a Korean robotics engineer who developed industrial robot systems for Korean manufacturing plants. His work on welding robots and assembly line automation helped Korean automakers achieve world-class manufacturing quality and efficiency.
timeline: Developed welding robots for Korean factories

name: Yoo Jae-sung
summary: Yoo Jae-sung is a Korean bioinformatics researcher who has contributed to genomic data analysis and precision medicine in South Korea. His development of computational tools for analyzing Korean genetic data has supported Korea's personalized medicine initiatives and biotechnology industry.

name: Hwang Sun-hyeop
summary: Hwang Sun-hyeop is a Korean food processing engineer who developed modern processing methods for Korean traditional foods. His work on standardizing kimchi, doenjang, and gochujang production helped Korean food companies scale up traditional food manufacturing for international markets.
timeline: Developed modern Korean food processing methods

name: Jeong Gi-young
summary: Jeong Gi-young is a Korean architect and urban planner who contributed to the design of Korean new towns and urban developments. His planning for cities like Bundang and Ilsan incorporated advanced infrastructure technology and became models for planned urban development in Asia.
timeline: Contributed to Korean new town planning

name: Lee Min-hwa
summary: Lee Min-hwa is a Korean technology entrepreneur and professor at KAIST who has been instrumental in developing Korea's startup ecosystem. He founded Medison (medical devices) and helped create the KAIST startup incubation programs that have produced many Korean technology companies.

name: Nam Dong-woo
summary: Nam Dong-woo was a Korean marine engineer who contributed to the design and construction of Korean shipyards. His engineering of drydock and shipbuilding facilities helped establish Hyundai and Samsung shipyards as among the most efficient in the world.

name: Min Pyeong-deok
summary: Min Pyeong-deok is a Korean aviation engineer who contributed to the development of Korea's aviation manufacturing industry. His work on aircraft component design and manufacturing helped Korean companies like Korean Aerospace Industries (KAI) develop indigenous aircraft production capabilities.
timeline: Contributed to T-50 trainer aircraft development

name: Yu Hak-seon
summary: Yu Hak-seon is a Korean nuclear engineer who contributed to nuclear reactor safety research in South Korea. His work on probabilistic safety assessment methods for nuclear power plants has been important for maintaining safety standards at Korea's nuclear facilities.

name: Choi Geon-ho
summary: Choi Geon-ho is a Korean geotechnical engineer who developed foundation design techniques for Korea's challenging geology. His research on soft ground improvement and deep foundation systems was crucial for constructing major Korean infrastructure including the Incheon International Airport on reclaimed land.
timeline: Contributed to Incheon Airport foundation design

name: Bae Gi-dong
summary: Bae Gi-dong is a Korean archaeologist who discovered and excavated numerous prehistoric and ancient sites across the Korean Peninsula. His archaeological research has expanded understanding of Korea's Bronze Age and Iron Age civilizations and their technological achievements, including metalworking and pottery.

name: Gang Shin-hang
summary: Gang Shin-hang is a Korean mechanical engineer who has contributed to tribology (friction, wear, and lubrication) research. His work on advanced lubricants and surface engineering has been important for Korean manufacturing industries, particularly in reducing wear in automotive engines and industrial machinery.

name: Kim Seong-su
summary: Kim Seong-su was a Korean industrialist and educator who founded Kyungsung Spinning and Weaving (Korea's first modern textile company) and Korea University. His investments in industrial technology and modern education helped build the foundations for Korea's later industrial development. He also founded the Dong-A Ilbo newspaper.
timeline: Established Posong Professional School (later Korea University)

name: Kim Jeong-gi
summary: Kim Jeong-gi was a Korean artist famous for his extraordinary ability to draw incredibly detailed and accurate illustrations from memory without any preliminary sketches. His remarkable spatial memory and anatomical knowledge demonstrated exceptional neurological capabilities that fascinated both art and science communities worldwide.
timeline: Live drawing performances went viral globally
Died suddenly in Paris at age 47

name: Sohn Jie-ae
summary: Sohn Jie-ae is a Korean journalist and communications expert who served as CEO of Arirang TV and led Korea's international broadcasting of science and technology stories. Her work has helped communicate Korean scientific achievements to global audiences.

name: Park Hyeon-ju
summary: Park Hyeon-ju is a Korean financial engineer who founded Mirae Asset Financial Group and pioneered quantitative investment strategies in South Korea. His application of mathematical modeling and technology to financial services helped modernize Korea's financial industry and establish Korean fintech capabilities.
timeline: Applied quantitative methods to Korean investments
Mirae Asset became major global asset manager

name: Yoon Jong-yong
summary: Yoon Jong-yong is a Korean electronics engineer who served as CEO of Samsung Electronics and led the company's transformation into a global technology leader. His technical leadership in display, semiconductor, and mobile technology development helped Samsung become the world's largest electronics company.
timeline: Samsung became world leader in multiple technology categories

name: Choi Gee-sung
summary: Choi Gee-sung is a Korean electronics engineer who served as CEO and Vice Chairman of Samsung Electronics. His technical expertise in semiconductor and display technologies guided Samsung's research and development strategy during its period of greatest technological advancement.
timeline: Samsung became world's largest smartphone maker

name: Sung Wan-jong
summary: Sung Wan-jong was a Korean nuclear engineer who founded Keangnam Enterprises and contributed to Korean nuclear power plant construction. His engineering and construction expertise helped build Korea's nuclear infrastructure, though he later became embroiled in political controversies.
timeline: Contributed to Korean nuclear plant construction

name: Oh Se-hoon
summary: While Oh Se-hoon is primarily a politician serving as Mayor of Seoul, his policies have promoted Seoul as a global smart city. Under his leadership, Seoul has implemented advanced urban technologies including smart transportation, digital governance, and IoT-based city management systems.

name: Shin Dong-bin
summary: Shin Dong-bin is a Korean-Japanese industrialist who serves as chairman of Lotte Group. Trained as a chemical engineer, he has overseen Lotte's expansion in food technology, petrochemicals, and construction engineering. Under his leadership, Lotte Chemical has become a major global chemical company.
timeline: Studied chemical engineering at Columbia University

name: Jeong Ui-seon
summary: Jeong Ui-seon (Euisun Chung) is a Korean automotive engineer who serves as Executive Chairman of Hyundai Motor Group. Under his technical leadership, Hyundai has invested heavily in electric vehicles, hydrogen fuel cell technology, and autonomous driving, positioning Korea as a leader in future mobility technology.
timeline: Became de facto leader of Hyundai Motor Group
Advanced hydrogen and EV technology development

name: Kim Beom-su
summary: Kim Beom-su is a Korean software engineer who founded Kakao Corporation, the company behind KakaoTalk, South Korea's dominant messaging platform used by over 90% of the population. His engineering innovations in mobile messaging, payments, and AI have made Kakao one of Korea's most important technology companies.
timeline: Kakao became major Korean tech platform

name: Lee Hae-jin
summary: Lee Hae-jin is a Korean computer engineer who founded Naver Corporation, South Korea's largest internet company and search engine. His engineering of the Korean-language search engine and internet portal created a platform that dominates Korean internet usage. Naver's Line messaging app also became the dominant messenger in Japan, Taiwan, and Thailand.
timeline: Naver became Korea's top search engine
Naver expanded into AI and cloud computing

name: Kwon Bong-seok
summary: Kwon Bong-seok is a Korean chemical engineer who served as CEO of LG Energy Solution, leading the company to become one of the world's largest electric vehicle battery manufacturers. His technical expertise in battery chemistry has guided LG's development of advanced lithium-ion and solid-state battery technologies.
timeline: Became CEO of LG Energy Solution
LG Energy Solution became global top-3 battery maker

name: Chung Eui-sun
summary: Already covered as Jeong Ui-seon. Duplicate check.

name: Kim Taek-jin
summary: Kim Taek-jin is a Korean software engineer who founded NCSOFT, one of the world's largest online game companies. His engineering of massively multiplayer online games (MMORPGs) like Lineage pioneered the online gaming business model. He has invested heavily in AI research through NCSOFT's AI Center.

name: Song Jae-jung
summary: Song Jae-jung is a Korean radio astronomer who contributed to the establishment of Korean radio astronomy capabilities. His work with the Korean VLBI Network (KVN) has helped Korea participate in international radio astronomy projects, including contributions to the Event Horizon Telescope that captured the first image of a black hole.
timeline: Contributed to Korean radio astronomy development
KVN contributed to first black hole image

name: Choi Kang-min
summary: Choi Kang-min is a Korean computational materials scientist who has applied machine learning and computational methods to materials discovery. His research on predicting new material properties using AI has advanced Korea's capabilities in computationally-driven materials science.
timeline: Applied computational methods to materials discovery
Integrated machine learning with materials science

name: Lee Jae-yong
summary: Lee Jae-yong is the de facto leader of Samsung Electronics who has guided the company's investments in advanced semiconductor foundry, AI, biotechnology, and next-generation telecommunications. While primarily a business leader, his technology strategy decisions have shaped the global semiconductor and electronics industries.
timeline: Led Samsung's strategic investments in semiconductors

name: Seo Bo-hyuk
summary: Seo Bo-hyuk is a Korean polymer chemist who developed specialty polymer materials for Korean electronic and automotive industries. His research on high-performance engineering plastics and functional polymers has supported Korean manufacturers in producing lightweight, durable components.

name: Kim Jeong-un
summary: While Kim Jong-un is primarily a political leader (Supreme Leader of North Korea), under his direction North Korea has developed nuclear weapons and ballistic missile technology, representing significant (though controversial) engineering achievements. North Korea's ICBM and nuclear programs demonstrate advanced rocketry and nuclear physics capabilities.
timeline: Became Supreme Leader of North Korea

name: Paik Nam-June
summary: Paik Nam-June was a Korean-American artist widely considered the father of video art. He was the first artist to use television as an artistic medium, creating interactive video sculptures and satellite art broadcasts. His work anticipated YouTube, video streaming, and the internet age by decades. He coined the term 'electronic superhighway' in 1974.
timeline: Built Video Synthesizer with Shuya Abe
Organized first global satellite art broadcast

name: Park Tae-joon
summary: Park Tae-joon was a Korean military officer and industrialist who founded POSCO (Pohang Iron and Steel Company) and built it into the world's most efficient steel producer. Despite having no steelmaking experience, he established a world-class integrated steel mill that was crucial for South Korea's industrialization and economic development.
timeline: Pohang became one of world's largest steel plants
POSCO became world's most efficient steelmaker

name: Huh Eun-nang
summary: Heo Nanseolheon was a female poet and scholar of the Joseon Dynasty whose intellectual accomplishments challenged gender barriers. She was educated in astronomy, mathematics, and philosophy in addition to literature. Her poems reflecting on nature show detailed astronomical observations. She died at just 27 but left a remarkable literary legacy.

name: Shin Saimdang
summary: Shin Saimdang was a Joseon Dynasty artist, calligrapher, and scholar who is revered as a model of Korean womanhood. Her detailed paintings of insects, plants, and natural scenes demonstrate precise scientific observation. She appears on the South Korean 50,000 won banknote and is the mother of the great scholar Yulgok Yi I.
